abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Agriculture
            Production Project for Gambia were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was satisfactory and grantee performance was
            also satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: lack of
            effective sensitization and adequate human resource in
            implementing institutions hinder delivery of emergency
            operations. Less complex and simply designed projects that
            also take into consideration the institutional capacities of
            the country is more likely to be successful. Interventions
            that help to mitigate climate change effects, such as
            adverse weather, would help boost production and alleviate
            poverty of beneficiaries. Close monitoring of annual plans
            as well as approved procurement plans are critical to
            completing emergency projects of this nature. It can be
            problematic using short-term emerging funding for long-term
            funding activities. The administrative agreements should
            clearly define reporting chain as well as the
            responsibilities of the Bank to the European Union (EU)
            delegation operating in the recipient countries.

15486248.projn:
GM-Gambia Emergency Agriculture Production
            Project -- P119892
15486248.trustfund:
TF096106-Emergency Agriculture
            Production Project,TF095759-GAMBIA - Agriculture Production
            Project P119892

repnme.cdata!:
Gambia - Emergency Agriculture Production
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency
            Agriculture Production Project for Gambia (GEAPP) is to
            improve access to agricultural inputs, equipment and
            postharvest storage capacity by targeted farmers in nine
            vulnerable districts. The closing date for the GEAPP will be
            extended from August 31, 2011 until December 31, 2011. This
            trust Fund grant of US$ 7.5 million to the Republic of The
            Gambia (Recipient) was made available by the European Union
            Food Crisis Rapid Respond Facility Trust Fund under the
            Global Food Crisis Response Program (the grant), of which
            US$ 3.7 million remains undisbursed. The Grant became
            effective on March 1, 2010. Such overall project objectives
            remain unchanged and continue to be considered achievable as
            progress in project implementation remains satisfactory. The
            performance of the project coordination unit is also
            satisfactory. Furthermore, there has been no suspension of
            disbursement for this grant and there are no overdue audit
            reports and interim financial reports. The extension is
            necessary to provide the recipient with adequate
            implementation time to complete all project activities and
            the achievement of the project's objectives, including
            the full rehabilitation of the 35 village seed storage
            facilities and three seed multiplication centers envisaged
            in the project.

TF096106-Emergency Agriculture

repnme.cdata!:
Gambia, The - Emergency Agriculture
            Production Project : environmental and social management framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency
            Agriculture Production Project for Gambia, The, is to
            improve access to agricultural inputs, equipment and
            postharvest storage capacity by targeted farmers in nine
            vulnerable districts. Negative impacts include: local air
            pollution, minimal local air pollution, pollution of surface
            water due to runoff and improper application, impede
            movement of livestock due to gullies, disposal of used oil,
            and disposal of used spare parts. Mitigation measures
            include: use enclosed trucks/cover fertilizer stocks; store
            seeds away from dwellings and stored food; train farmers and
            extension worker on the right application rates and contour
            farming; proper ventilation of seed stores; training on soil
            and water conservation; avoid disposal used oil into or near
            water bodies; regular preventive maintenance; accidental
            spillage near water bodies must be immediately cleaned; and
            training on soil and water conservation techniques for
            participating members of the Seed Growers Association to be
            able to avoid soil degradation.
